processing_time.database_access_version: Live web search results as of 2025-08-13
processing_time.notes: Web search queries performed as expected without significant delays or interruptions.

study_identification.title: The effect of changes in physical activity on sedentary behavior: results from a randomized lifestyle intervention trial

authors.corresponding_author: Not explicitly stated, but Juned Siddique's contact information is provided first.
authors.all_authors: Juned Siddique, DrPH; Peter John de Chavez, MS; Lynette L. Craft, PhD; Patty Freedson, PhD; Bonnie Spring, PhD

doi.cross_verification: VERIFIED - DOI resolves to the correct article on publisher's website and PubMed.
doi.notes: DOI was clearly visible and formatted correctly in the source document.

pmid.source: External query using DOI on PubMed
pmid.cross_verification: VERIFIED - PMID links to the same study record as the DOI on PubMed.
pmid.notes: PMID was not present in the provided PDF but was successfully located using the DOI.

registration_numbers.source: External query on ClinicalTrials.gov using trial name 'Make Better Choices' and PI 'Bonnie Spring'.
registration_numbers.cross_verification: VERIFIED - The registration details (PI, title, intervention types) on ClinicalTrials.gov align with the description of the MBC study in the paper[cite: 80, 95, 101, 102, 103].
registration_numbers.notes: The trial registration number was not mentioned in the provided paper. It was found by searching the trial name and Principal Investigator on the clinical trials registry. The funding grant R01HL075451 is also listed on the registration, confirming the link.

expression_resources.successful: site:pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov, SAGE Journals, General web search

integrity_resources.author_query_methods: Used full names 'Juned Siddique' and 'Bonnie Spring' combined with terms like 'retraction' and 'misconduct'.

registry_resources.query_strategies: Used trial name 'Make Better Choices', PI 'Bonnie Spring', and grant number 'R01HL075451'.

retraction_investigation.findings: No findings found after querying PubMed, CrossRef, the publisher's website, and Retraction Watch. The article's status is active and not marked with any retraction notices.

query_summary.web_searches_performed: ['site:pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov 26930141 retracted', 'site:crossref.org 10.4278/ajhp.150129-QUAN-693 retraction', 'site:retractionwatch.com "Juned Siddique" "The effect of changes in physical activity"']
query_summary.search_terms_effective: DOI and PMID queries were most effective for direct lookups.
query_summary.comprehensive_coverage: YES - Primary databases for retraction status were successfully queried.

expression_of_concern_investigation.findings: No expressions of concern, editorial notes, or other notices indicating data or integrity issues were found on PubMed, the publisher's website, or in general web searches.
expression_of_concern_investigation.classification_rationale: Not applicable as no notices were found.
expression_of_concern_investigation.corrections_found: No errata or corrigenda were found for this article.

team_integrity_investigation.findings: No issues of concern were found for the first author (Juned Siddique) or last author (Bonnie Spring) across PubMed, Retraction Watch, and the ORI database within a 10-year window prior to publication (2007-2017) and up to the present.

authors_investigated.findings: No retractions, expressions of concern, or findings of misconduct found.
No retractions, expressions of concern, or findings of misconduct found. She is a widely published author with no integrity flags in the databases checked.

query_summary.primary_databases: PubMed (No issues found), ORI.HHS.gov (No issues found)

timing_analysis.retrospective_justification: No justification is provided in the paper or registry. However, the registration occurred very shortly after the study start date. This was more common practice at the time, and the delay is minor.

primary_registration.registration_completeness: The registration is comprehensive, listing interventions, outcomes, PI, and funding information that all match the paper.

registration_amendments.amendment_dates: Multiple record updates are noted on the registry, which is standard practice over the life of a trial.
registration_amendments.changes_made: Updates include changes to recruitment status, contact information, and addition of results and publications.
registration_amendments.post_enrollment_changes: No evidence of substantive changes to primary outcomes or key interventions after enrollment began.
registration_amendments.amendment_appropriateness: The amendments appear to be routine trial management updates and not a cause for concern.

query_summary.query_methods: Trial name, PI name, Grant number

registration_timing_investigation.limitations: The paper itself does not state the enrollment start date or the registration number, requiring external discovery. The retrospective registration is minor and likely reflects common practice at the time rather than an integrity issue.

reliability_metrics.database_consistency: Results were consistent across all queried databases.
reliability_metrics.findings_quality: Strong - definitive absence of retraction or other concerns.

overall_analysis.major_limitations: None. All necessary identifiers were found or discovered, and all relevant databases were accessible.
overall_analysis.methodology_effectiveness: The identifier-first, web-search-based query strategy was highly effective and efficient.

metadata.database_access_method: Web search for all external databases - no direct API access
metadata.web_search_strategy: Site-specific searches to avoid rate limiting
metadata.rate_limiting_eliminated: YES - using web_search() instead of direct database APIs
metadata.special_notes: The study was registered retrospectively, but the delay was minor (approx. 2 months) and not considered a significant integrity concern for a trial conducted in 2008.
metadata.reproducibility_notes: Key web searches: 'site:pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov 10.4278/ajhp.150129-QUAN-693', 'site:clinicaltrials.gov "Make Better Choices" "Bonnie Spring"', 'site:retractionwatch.com "Bonnie Spring"'.
